items.title: Earthquake Jolts Bay Area Residents Awake
items.summary: A 4.3-magnitude earthquake was strong enough to rattle nerves in the middle of the night, especially in the heavily populated East Bay where it was centered.

items.title: Tiger Handler Linked to Joe Exotic Is Fatally Mauled by Tiger
items.summary: Ryan Easley, 37, was performing at his family-run private zoo in Hugo, Okla., when a tiger attacked him, the authorities said. He was pronounced dead at the scene.

items.title: Tech Executive Dies After Falling 2,000 Feet on Mount Shasta
items.summary: While the Argentine hiker and entrepreneur, Matias Augusto Travizano, was descending the mountain, he fell down a glacier, the authorities said.

items.title: Trump’s Tax Cut Is Underwater. Can a ‘Refund Boom’ Save It?
items.summary: Republicans are hoping a new name, along with larger refunds for many Americans next year, can buoy an economic agenda that polls show is unpopular.

items.title: American Investors Will License and Oversee TikTok’s U.S. Version, White House Says
items.summary: The change is part of a deal to bring TikTok under U.S. ownership to avert a looming ban.

items.title: The Firing of Educators Over Kirk Comments Follows a Familiar Playbook
items.summary: Conservative efforts to call out and punish educators over liberal ideas have grown for years, led in part by Charlie Kirk himself.

items.title: Trump press secretary denies president is weaponizing justice department and dodges question on autism announcement – live
items.summary: <p>Karoline Leavitt claims media reporting of pressure campaign is ‘gaslighting’ and evades question on expected announcement about acetaminophen </p><p>Per my last post, it’s important to underscore that <strong>autism has been a focus for Kennedy</strong>. Earlier this month, the Wall Street Journal <a href="https://www.wsj.com/health/healthcare/rfk-jr-hhs-to-link-autism-to-tylenol-use-in-pregnancy-and-folate-deficiencies-e3acbb4c?gaa_at=eafs&amp;gaa_n=ASWzDAhwJUrTkQQKbf3fCPdx7a164OXbN3bA3HHVYMK1BmPXirXKdNsVALYTST5ieD8%3D&amp;gaa_ts=68d146ed&amp;gaa_sig=1YrB1_HneQxFDdL6Iz82R1yFPTDUITrQ991UFvw7hlf3GcuaXlh6Tq2SIVnB6tq-dwU4LO2n-laPq65v0IBmQA%3D%3D">reported</a> that Kennedy planned to announce that use of Tylenol by pregnant women was potentially linked to <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/society/autism">autism</a> spectrum disorder. Kennedy has claimed that the US is in the grip of an “autism epidemic” fuelled by “environmental toxins”.</p><p>A reminder that the <strong>American </strong><strong>College of Obstetrics and Gynecology </strong>(ACOG) says there’s “no clear evidence” linking “prudent” use of acetaminophen to issues with fetal development.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/live/2025/sep/22/donald-trump-charlie-kirk-autism-us-politics-live-news-updates">Continue reading...</a>

items.title: Republican slams FCC chair’s comments on Kimmel suspension: ‘absolutely inappropriate’
items.summary: <p>Rand Paul, a Kentucky senator, also said Disney and ABC have no obligation to employ the late-night host</p><p>Republican US senator <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/rand-paul">Rand Paul</a> broke with Federal Communications Commission chair Brendan Carr for seemingly putting his finger on the scale in the ongoing dispute between suspended talkshow host Jimmy Kimmel and his employer, Disney-owned ABC.</p><p>Paul, Kentucky’s junior senator, spoke Sunday on NBC’s <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/meet-the-press/video/rand-paul-condemns-lawfare-of-all-sorts-as-trump-eyes-rivals-full-interview-248023621818?utm_source=newsletter&amp;utm_medium=email&amp;utm_content=Rand%20Paul%20condemns%20%E2%80%98lawfare%20of%20all%20sorts%E2%80%99%20as%20Trump%20eyes%20rivals%3A%20Full%20interview&amp;utm_campaign=CORRECTION%3A%20MTP%20%E2%80%93%20Sen.%20Rand%20Paul%3A%20On%20a%20potential%20shutdown%3A%20%E2%80%9CBoth%20parties%20are%20terrible%20at%20addressing%20our%20deficit%E2%80%9D">Meet the Press</a> about the Donald Trump-appointed communications regulator who recently threatened to pull ABC affiliate broadcast licenses if Disney did not take action against Kimmel over his comments suggesting that Republicans were trying to characterize the alleged killer of far-right commentator Charlie Kirk as “anything other” than part of the president’s “Maga gang”.</p> <a href="https://www.theguardian.com/us-news/2025/sep/22/rand-paul-fcc-brendan-carr-jimmy-kimmel-suspension">Continue reading...</a>
